title: 31b16. Inspections under the Occupational Safety and Health Act of 1970.
text:
(a)  
Sec 8(e) of the OSHA provides
that: (1)  during an inspection under that Act an authorized
representative of the employees shall be given an opportunity to accompany the
OSHA Inv; or (2)  where there is no authorized employee representative,
the OSHA Inv shall consult with a reasonable number of employees concerning
health and safety at their workplace. (b)  
Time spent by an employee
accompanying the OSHA Inv as in (a)(1) above is not considered hours worked.
Sec 8(e) of the OSHA does not require that an employee representative accompany
the Inv, nor does it impose a duty on the employer to require an employee to
accompany the Inv. Such time spent by an employee is considered voluntary and
primarily (although not wholly) for the benefit of the employees. (c)  
Time spent by employees consulting
with the OSHA Inv as in (a)(2) above during their normal workday when required
to be on the employer’s premises is hours worked.
html:
(a)   Sec 8(e) of the OSHA provides that:

 

(1)  during an inspection under that Act an authorized representative of the employees shall be given an opportunity to accompany the OSHA Inv; or

 

(2)  where there is no authorized employee representative, the OSHA Inv shall consult with a reasonable number of employees concerning health and safety at their workplace.

 

(b)   Time spent by an employee accompanying the OSHA Inv as in (a)(1) above is not considered hours worked. Sec 8(e) of the OSHA does not require that an employee representative accompany the Inv, nor does it impose a duty on the employer to require an employee to accompany the Inv. Such time spent by an employee is considered voluntary and primarily (although not wholly) for the benefit of the employees.

 

(c)   Time spent by employees consulting with the OSHA Inv as in (a)(2) above during their normal workday when required to be on the employer’s premises is hours worked.
